title: "Yeah, I said it!" P!nk lashes out at Jason Aldean and we have no idea what the hell she's talking about
description:
Oh Good. P!nk has opinions on Jason Aldean. I know what you're thinking. "Brodigan, say it isn't so! P!nk? P!NK?!"

No, it's so. And while we have no idea what the hell she is talking about in this clip from our friends at Mythinformed, we have the feeling she is not a fan.

— (@)
There are people waiting to love you even if the people around you are terrible. Even if they give you Jason Aldean vibes... yeah I just did that. I said it.

You just did and said what, exactly?

She said the name of someone in the news on stage, at a concert, for a cheap pop. GOOD FOR YOU. It's the equivalent of making a reference to doing drugs, or screaming "SEX... now that I have your attention."

And when she says "Jason Aldean" vibes she means...what? The vibes of being a dedicated father and husband? I'm not entirely sure who P!nk's audience is these days, but I'm assuming it's young girls and someone giving off a vibe that he loves his family should be a good thing. I know it is out in small towns. Maybe not the cities P!nk performs in.

What the artist most likely means is the vibe of someone who has political opinions they disagree with. To the Left, that's the worst vibe you can give off. P!nk has always been an outspoken progressive. She no doubt supported the Democrat party-endorsed riots of a few years ago. I'm sure she donated to the Minnesota Freedom Fund. And it would not surprise me if she campaigned for and helped elect the Democrat elected officials whose policies have encouraged the increased crime in those Democrat-run cities.

Poor Jason Aldean. Things were finally turning around. He has the #1 song in America and he could finally put this national nightmare behind him. Now, he has to carry the burden of upsetting P!nk. It never ends.

>

<

Brodigan is Grand Poobah of this here website and when he isn't writing words about things enjoys day drinking, pro-wrestling, and country music. You can find him on the Twitter too.

title: Watch: Brazen shoplifter catches a literal ass whoopin' (with a stick) by a clerk who has been pushed too far
description:
"Yeah, that's me. You're probably wondering how I wound up in this predicament."

The internet has been cluttered with crime videos. CNTL+ALT+progessives cities electing progressive leaders who enact progressive policies that have made stealing legal-ish. On the rare occasion, we see an employee try to stop it. If they work for a corporate chain they're the ones who get fired. Yes, even if they are only recording the theft or acting in self-defense so they don't get murdered.

It's not worth getting involved when it's a corporate chain run by elitist executives don't give a sh*t about you. Defending a small business, like a convenience store, where they care about the customers and the community is a different story. That brings us to today's cigarette thief.

— (@)

By "thief" I mean a man with a mask over his face filling up A FREAKIN' GARBAGE CAN" with cigarettes in plain few of the two employees, daring them to do something.

Sweet mother of God, did they dare! One guy stopped the theif from leaving. Possibly, just to stop him from leaving with the stolen merchandise.

Or to just give the other employee enough time to grab a broom handle and go "ECW's Sandman with a kendo stick" on the cigarette thief... who was now in the fetal position questioning his life choices.

Though the real MVP is the man who remembered to do it for the content. He whipped out his phone to grab evidence and tried to reason with the employees to let the guy go so as not to risk their own lives. But when they decided to go another way:

That's what we call getting your ass whooped.

Yes. Yes, it is. A more glorious taste of justice wrapped in instant karma I could not think of.

>

<

Brodigan is Grand Poobah of this here website and when he isn't writing words about things enjoys day drinking, pro-wrestling, and country music. You can find him on the Twitter too.

title: Social worker gets blacklisted for criticizing Dylan Mulvaney, wondering aloud how someone without breasts sells sports bras
description:
Let's file this story under "Pay Attention, America" because while it takes place in the UK, it's a future that Dylan Mulvaney has explicitly stated he, she, and/or they want in this country. A social worker has been suspended and blacklisted from work over having criticized Dylan's authenticity of being a woman.

The social worker is also a lesbian. Especially in the UK, lesbians are now ranked lower on the Left's pound-for-pound most marginalized rankings than straight, white men who virtue signal about being trans allies.

— (@)

Louise Chivers is, or was, a social worker with twenty-five years on the job. Then one day, during I'm assuming a conversation with coworkers, Dylan came up. Louise called Dylan a “misogynist who mocks women” and wondered how a "skinny gay man with no tits" could be selling sports bras.

You may not remember this because it was right after Bud Light, but Dylan also signed a brand ambassador deal with Nike.

— (@)

Because of this, Louise was told the agency she relies on to find her social work will no longer find her job until a full investigation of her scandalous comments had been conducted. Chives tells The Telegraph it's clear what is going on and that because she is gender-critical she is being blacklisted and slandered as "transphobic."

“On this particular occasion, we had been discussing gender-neutral toilets and I said I wasn’t comfortable using them because statistics show women are eight times more likely to be raped in one."

“I said I would struggle to buy Nike clothes any more because I didn’t agree with Dylan Mulvaney advertising sports bras because I thought it made a mockery of women."

What is happening to Louise is exactly what Dylan Mulvaney wants to happen in America. Well, not "exactly." Dylan wants thought crimes like those committed by Louise to be ILLEGAL and not just grounds for termination from your job.

— (@)

Joe Biden's favorite internet personality thinks it should be illegal to call someone by the "wrong" pronouns. By "wrong," what Dylan means is the correct pronoun. Just not the pronouns Dylan would prefer to be called. No word on if the influencer also wants it illegal to call a fat kid "Tiny."

Also, it is unclear Dylan wants you/your arrested or to be hit with a significant financial penalty.

The part about "making a mockery of women," we'd all be screwed. I wasn't the only one who, prior to the White House visit, thought Dylan was a parody acting out how he thought girls acted based on a hatred of girls. Boy, do I feel silly now!

I can't think of an example in America, at least one that has made the news, over someone getting suspended or fired from work for criticizing a TikToker. Getting arrested for reading the Bible, yes. But not fired for criticizing an influencer.

Yet.

>

<

title: "It was worth it": Police arrest teen for reading the Bible in a park near a drag queen event for children
description:
A video has gone viral of a Wisconsin teen reading a Bible in the park. It seems innocent and it makes you wonder why he would get arrested for reading a Bible passage. Well, as it turns out, he was reading the Bible in a public park where men were dressed like scantily clad women were gyrating in front of children. A "family-friendly drag show" I believe it's called.

It's still innocent (the Bible reading part) and shouldn't be grounds for arresting the teen. But... know what I mean?

— (@)

Jason Storms, who recorded the video, told The Republic Sentinal that per orders from city leaders, people were arrested for praying and talking to attendees of this family-friendly sexual cabaret. “It was open to the public, thus the public's right to free speech carries with them. One was arrested later in the day for preaching on the public sidewalk outside the venue and is being charged with unlawful use of sound amplification and resisting arrest.”

A few dozen police officers were on duty to protect the performance where men dressed like scantily clad women were gyrating in front of children. This makes the following two pieces of information from TRS quite curious.

1. Performers dressed in lingerie were “dancing and gyrating in front of little children, who were invited to give them one dollar bills.”

2. "Sexually explicit conduct" in front of minors is illegal according to Wisconsin Law.

Marcus Schroeder, the chad who got arrested for spitting Bible verses, said he'd not only do it again but would do so with great aplomb.

"If the police wanted to try and set an example for others or anything like that, the only thing I’ve seen is actually the exact opposite, where more and more people are seeing the severity of what’s going on and being called to more action."

On occasion, we here at the Louder with Crowder Dot Com website will present stories to you from abroad with the caption "pay attention, America." A story like this is Exhibit Q why.

In April, a Canadian politician wanted to create buffer zones to make it illegal for citizens to criticize men who dress as women while they perform for little children and the enjoyment of adults who enjoy watching men dressed as women perform for little children. Not unlike the buffer zones we already have in this country that says you can't be pro-life within fifty yards of a Planned Parenthood.

This is now the second story since then of Christians in THIS COUNTRY being arrested for quoting the Bible. The last one was in Pennsylvania where police arrested man for saying "God is not the author of confusion."

Pay attention, America.

>

<

title: Country music's stranglehold on the Billboard Charts shows the Left is losing their culture war
description:
For the first time EVER, country music has scored the top three spots on Billboard's Top 100. The rest of the top ten is Taylor Swift and a bunch of K-Pop artists (I think). But at the top of the list?

1. Jason Aldean, "Try That in A Small Town"

2. Morgan Wallen, "Last Night"

3. Luke Combs, "Fast Car"

Whether this is because of or in spite of, I can't help but notice all three artists have been the target of the Left over some recent woke fauxtroversy or another. Yet fans continue to support the artists and the songs. Go figure.

I'm sure a lot of it has to do with who country music fans are. We live in the parts of real America where people can disagree with each other and live in harmony. As opposed to progressive America, where if you're every worldview isn't affirmed, someone needs to be destroyed. This is not to say there aren't some insufferable examples. But like when Zack Bryan and Travis Tritt had a public blowup over Bud Light and controversial titface performer Dylan Mulvaney, they talked it out. Turns out they agree on some things, disagree on something, and the world didn't end. Again, go figure.

I don't think we need to recap the Jason Aldean drama at this point. Leftists attacked him over things they claim he thinks that he doesn't think. Fans showed what happens when you try that in a small town. To quote Brittney Aldean, that sure did backfire.

Morgan Wallen was drunk one night and dropped a "soft G" with friends. The Left attempted to cancel him from ever appearing on television again, but even P. Diddy called it BS: "Morgan [used the N-word] while talking to his boy. People make mistakes. Now we’re moving on with love and respect for everybody that was hurt or affected. It’s time to forgive."

Wallen's single has grown so huge, "Last Night" is even played on New York City radio where you'd think he'd be canceled over having a funny accent by closed-minded and intolerant NYers. The personal irony for me as a NY country music fan is he's my least favorite of his crew. I dig him, but Ernest, Jelly Roll, and Hardy all rank ahead.

The Luke Combs "controversy" is the dumbest one of all of them. He covered Tracy Chapman's "Fast Car." It was one of the top songs of the late 80s from one of the top artists of the late 80s. Chapman is both black and gay, so, of course, the journalisming content creators at Washington Post felt it necessary to try and create racism and homophobia where none existed, claiming Chapman would have an almost zero chance at that achievement herself.

"Fast Car" by Tracy Chapman was nominated for 3 Grammy Awards including Record of the Year and Song of the Year. She won for Best Female Pop Vocal Performance and Best New Artist. She has 7 other nominations for Grammy Awards and two wins.

And it needs to be pointed out with the exception of Aldean, neither Wallen nor Combs do anything political in the slightest. Even with Aldean, prior to "Small Town" the most he's done was golf with Trump once and defend his wife against media attacks. Americans just want to enjoy good music. The side that doesn't want to let them keeps losing.

>

<

Brodigan is Grand Poobah of this here website and when he isn't writing words about things enjoys day drinking, pro-wrestling, and country music. You can find him on the Twitter too.

title: Five takeaways from the Left's latest indictment of Donald Trump
description:
On Tuesday, former president Donald Trump was indicted (again) on federal criminal allegations he tried to remain president despite losing the 2020 election to Joe Biden. The indictment (found here) claims conspiracy to defraud the government, conspiracy to obstruct an official proceeding, obstruction of and attempt to obstruct an official proceeding and conspiracy against rights. Yes, Jack Smith and Joe Biden's Department of Justice is behind it. Emphasis on "Biden's DOJ."

1. It’s 45 pages of First Amendment-protected activity broken up by four captions.

The core argument is that Trump didn't believe the election was stolen, but said so anyway. Others in his orbit at the time have echoed the same. Then something something, January 6th happened. Let's say, worst case scenario, he was lying the whole time and Trump knew he lost. That's not a felony. That is Donald Trump engaging in the same political speech Democrats engage in time and time again when they lose. Smith, on behalf of Biden's DOJ, wants to criminalize political speech that goes against the Left.

— (@)

Democrats encourage their supporters to deny election results and overturn electors all the time. In 2016 that meant threatening electors, threatening to burn their families alive, and enlisting celebrities to encourage electors to overturn the will of the people.

— (@)

2. The timing.

This is the third time Trump indictments were dropped the day after there were stories about Biden family corruption between Joe and his scumbag son. Once is a coincidence. Three times... you would think the DOJ would wait a few days to NOT make it look this obvious. The Biden Adminstration doesn't care and knows they can count on corporate media to carry whatever water is necessary.

— (@)

3. Jack Smith, the prosecutor, has straight up said Trump is guilty until proven innocent.

During his press conference, Smith went on a rant demagoguing Donald Trump, calling him the mastermind behind the darkest day in American history, and promising to take down this evil monster once and for all. Oh, by the way...

In the meantime I must emphasize that the indictment is only an allegation and that the defendant must be presumed innocent until proven guilty beyond a reasonable doubt in a court of law.

4. The Obama-appointed judge who will oversee the trial LOVES throwing people in jail for J6.

Judge Tanya Chutkan has been picked to oversee the trial. The Left loves her so much she was featured in content created by the Associated Press: "Chutkan has handed out tougher sentences than the [Justice Department] was seeking in seven cases, matched its requests in four others, and sent all 11 riot defendants who have come before her behind bars."

There were four cases where prosecutors didn't seek jail time, but Chutkan locked them up anyway.

Not only will Trump NOT come before a jury of his peers -- Washington DC is 90% Democrat -- but the judge is a bitter partisan who looks for an excuse to toss opponents behind bars.

5. A Jack Smith conviction has already been UNANIMOUSLY overturned by the Supreme Court.

Former Virginia governor Bob McDonnell, a Republican and a rising star in the party, was convicted in 2014 of violating federal bribery law. The Supreme Court in 2016 ruled UNANIMOUSLY that no laws were broken. Unanimously, even Ruth Bader Ginsberg.

Smith also went after Democrat Senator Bob Menendez in 2015 on bribery charges. It was declared a mistrial in 2017.

Jack Smith likes to chase headlines. This is the first time he has done so to actively interfere with an election.

>

<
